Notices the runaway train and realizes there is no driver in the engine, showing alertness and awareness of the danger.
Attempts to stop the train by pulling the emergency brake cord upon seeing no driver, showing initiative and quick reaction.
Expresses confusion when the emergency brake cord comes out, indicating unpreparedness for sabotage but maintains composure.
Encourages Grover by saying 'C'mon. You hold the back of my belt.' and proceeds to attempt a difficult and dangerous task together.
Persistently tries to move the pin to stop the runaway train, supported by friends holding him, showing determination and trust in others.
Smiles and shakes head at Grover's reckless behavior, showing amusement rather than judgment.
Makes a lighthearted comment about the engine having a grin, engaging in casual friendly conversation with Hilly.
Refers to Grover's action with a teasing remark ('just bagged himself another pussey'), indicating camaraderie and informal friendliness.
